EXPANSE.blindedDesc: The character cannot see and automatically fails ability tests reliant on sight, such as Perception (Seeing).
EXPANSE.deafenedDesc: The character cannot hear and automatically fails ability tests reliant on hearing, such as Perception (Hearing).
EXPANSE.dyingDesc: The character is in danger of perishing. A dying character loses 1 point of Constitution score each round on the start of the character’s turn. When the character’s Constitution score reaches –3, the character dies. Successful first aid applied to a dying character stabilizes their condition, making them helpless, unconscious, and wounded instead. They must recover from these conditions normally (see Interludes in Chapter 5).
EXPANSE.exhaustedDesc: The character is severely fatigued. The character’s Speed is halved and they cannot take the Charge or Run actions. An exhausted character who receives an additional fatigued or exhausted condition becomes helpless.
EXPANSE.fatiguedDesc: The character is tired and cannot take the Charge or Run actions. A fatigued character who receives an additional fatigued condition becomes exhausted.
EXPANSE.freefallDesc: The character is effectively weightless in a microgravity or free-fall environment. The character can only move with access to hand-holds, a surface to push off from, or some type of thrust (like from a thruster pack) and, once moving, continues to move with the same speed and trajectory unless acted upon to stop or change their movement.
EXPANSE.helplessDesc: The character is incapable of doing anything. The character cannot take any actions.
EXPANSE.hinderedDesc: The character’s Speed is halved (round down) and they cannot take the Charge or Run actions.
EXPANSE.injuredDesc: The character is hurt. The character has a –1 penalty to all tests and is fatigued, unable to take the Charge or Run actions. An injured character who receives an additional injured condition becomes wounded.
EXPANSE.Name: Name
EXPANSE.proneDesc: The character is lying on the ground. The character cannot take the Charge or Run actions, as they can only move by crawling, and standing up from prone requires a Move action using half the character’s Speed. Melee attacks have a +1 bonus against prone characters, while ranged attacks have a –1 penalty.
EXPANSE.restrainedDesc: The character’s Speed becomes 0 and they effectively cannot move. A restrained condition may prevent a character from taking certain other actions as well, defined by the nature of the restraint.
EXPANSE.Losses.tooltip.collateral: Crew members in one compartment of the ship suffer 1d6 damage. If there is crew in multiple areas, the GM chooses which area(s) are affected.
EXPANSE.Losses.tooltip.hull: Damage to the hull imposes a -1 penalty on Hull score totals (after dice are rolled).
EXPANSE.Losses.tooltip.maneuverability: Damage to the ship's thrusters or navigation impose a -1 penalty on Dexterity (Piloting) checks.
EXPANSE.Losses.tooltip.sensors: Damage to the ship's sensors reduces its Sensors score by 1.
EXPANSE.Losses.tooltip.weapons: Damage to the ship's weapons impose a -1 penalty to the target numbers to evade attacks with those weapons and -1 to the weapon's damage.
EXPANSE.Losses.tooltip.reactoroffline: Damage to the ship's reactor or power systems takes the main drive offline; the ship is incapable of high-g maneuvers and suffers a -2 penalty to evasion defensive actions.
EXPANSE.Losses.tooltip.weaponoffline: Damage leaves one of the ship's weapon systems non-functional. The GM may choose or roll randomly to determine the affected weapon.
EXPANSE.Losses.CannotSingle: Ship cannot take more single losses!
EXPANSE.Losses.CannotDouble: Ship cannot take more double losses!
EXPANSE.Losses.CannotSerious: Ship cannot take more serious losses!
EXPANSE.unconsciousDesc: The character is unaware of their surroundings or the passage of time. The character falls prone and is helpless, unable to take any actions.
EXPANSE.woundedDesc: The character is severely injured. The character has a –2 penalty to all tests and is exhausted, their Speed halved and unable to take the Charge or Run actions. A wounded character who receives an additional injured or wounded condition becomes dying.
EXPANSE.WARNING.CannotRemoveEffect: You cannot remove {name} while character is {inhibitor}!
EXPANSE.WARNING.ThisIsNotValidParticipan: This Is Not a Valid Participant!
SETTINGS.BeltDark: Belter: Black dice - white stunt die.
SETTINGS.BeltLight: Belter: White dice - black stunt die.
SETTINGS.EarthDark: Earther: Blue dice - white stunt die.
SETTINGS.EarthLight: Earther: White dice - blue stunt die.
SETTINGS.MarsDark: Martian: Black dice - red stunt die.
SETTINGS.MarsLight: Martian: Red dice - black stunt die.
SETTINGS.ProtoDark: Protomolecule: Black dice - blue stunt die.
SETTINGS.ProtoLight: Protomolecule: Blue dice - black stunt die.
